;{{Nihongo|Simon|ã·ã¢ã³| Shimon}}
:{{anime voices|Tetsuya Kakihara}}
:{{anime voices|Tetsuya Kakihara}}
:Simon is a fourteen year old digger from Jiiha village. Although he is initially looked down because of it, Simon excels at drilling the earth, while the drill itself quickly becomes his trademark symbol. One day he finds a mysterious drill-shaped item, which is later revealed to be the key for a head-shaped robot he also finds buried in the soil. With the help of the robot, Kamina, and Yoko, he fights off a Gunmen who broke into the village. While finishing the Gunmen off with a drill-like attack, they reach the surface world. After Kamina's death, he is chosen to be the leader of the Gurren Brigade in his place.
:Simon is a fourteen year old digger from Jiiha village. Although he is initially looked down because of it, Simon excels at drilling the earth, while the drill itself quickly becomes his trademark symbol. One day he finds a mysterious drill-shaped item, which is later revealed to be the key for a head-shaped robot he also finds buried in the soil. With the help of the robot, Kamina, and Yoko, he fights off a Gunmen who broke into the village. While finishing the Gunmen off with a drill-like attack, they reach the surface world. After Kamina's death, he is chosen to be the leader of the Gurren Brigade in his place.
â
[[Image:Gurren-Lagann - Kamina.jpg|left|200px|thumb|Kamina]]
 
;{{Nihongo|Kamina|ã«ãã}}
;{{Nihongo|Kamina|ã«ãã}}
:{{anime voices|Katsuyuki Konishi}}
:{{anime voices|Katsuyuki Konishi}}
:Kamina is a young man from Jiiha village who dreams of leaving the village and go to the surface, which he saw as a kid. He's very passionate about his goals, expressing his wishes through energetic speeches, which seems to affect all those who hear him. He convinces Simon to help him with his plan to drill through the roof of the village and get to the world above, but the plan failed and he was put in prison. He left the village shortly thereafter with the help of Simon and a young girl named Yoko, as a result of fighting a Gunmen, who broke into the village from the surface.
:Kamina is a young man from Jiiha village who dreams of leaving the village and go to the surface, which he saw as a kid. He's very passionate about his goals, expressing his wishes through energetic speeches, which seems to affect all those who hear him. He convinces Simon to help him with his plan to drill through the roof of the village and get to the world above, but the plan failed and he was put in prison. He left the village shortly thereafter with the help of Simon and a young girl named Yoko, as a result of fighting a Gunmen, who broke into the village from the surface.
â
[[Image:Gurren-Lagann - Yoko2.jpg|left|200px|thumb|Yoko]]
 
;{{Nihongo|Yoko Ritona|ã¨ã¼ã³ã»ãªãããã¼|YÅko Ritona}}
;{{Nihongo|Yoko Ritona|ã¨ã¼ã³ã»ãªãããã¼|YÅko Ritona}}
:{{anime voices|Marina Inoue}}
:{{anime voices|Marina Inoue}}
:Yoko is a girl from Jiiha's neighboring village Ritona, who had been chasing the Gunmen which entered Jiiha village. She wields an extensive range of firearms and has previous experience fighting Gunmen. She uses her marksmanship from afar to assist Kamina and Simon, while they pilot their respective Gunmen. Although she is said to be around the same age as Simon, she is much more mature (mentally and physically) she also is one of the most rational of the group. After Kamina dies she starts developing feelings for Simon.
:Yoko is a girl from Jiiha's neighboring village Ritona, who had been chasing the Gunmen which entered Jiiha village. She wields an extensive range of firearms and has previous experience fighting Gunmen. She uses her marksmanship from afar to assist Kamina and Simon, while they pilot their respective Gunmen. Although she is said to be around the same age as Simon, she is much more mature (mentally and physically) she also is one of the most rational of the group. After Kamina dies she starts developing feelings for Simon.

Line 78: Line 74:
===Terminology===
===Terminology===
====Beastmen====
====Beastmen====
â
[[Image:Gurren-Lagann - Beastmen Empire Group.jpg|right|150px|thumb|The Four Beastmen Generals]]
 
Beastmen are non-spiral beings created and cloned by Lord Genome to fight by piloting Gunmen. The animals on the planet are failed experiments. Beastmen and many other animals found on the planet cannot sexually reproduce, and instead multiply solely via cloning.
Beastmen are non-spiral beings created and cloned by Lord Genome to fight by piloting Gunmen. The animals on the planet are failed experiments. Beastmen and many other animals found on the planet cannot sexually reproduce, and instead multiply solely via cloning.
â
{{-}}
 
====Gunmen====
====Gunmen====
{{main|List of Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann mecha}}
{{main|List of Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann mecha}}
â
[[Image:Gurren-Lagann - Gurren Brigade Gunmen.jpg|right|150px|thumb|Gunmen]]
+
{{Nihongo|'''Gunmen'''|ã¬ã³ã¡ã³|Ganmen}} are the type of [[mecha]] used in the series. The name itself as a whole means "face" and can be broken down into "gun" and "man" — unsurprisingly, the mecha themselves are centered around faces. Gunmen sport a variety of weaponry — the more primitive models only use large clubs or bare hands, while more advanced ones use cannons or beam weapons. Gunmen powered by the "Spiral Energy" inherent in humans' DNA are much more powerful than those piloted by Beastmen.
â
{{Nihongo|'''Gunmen'''|ã¬ã³ã¡ã³|Ganmen}} are the type of [[mecha]] used in the series. The name itself as a whole means "face" and can be broken down into "gun" and "man" — unsurprisingly, the mecha themselves are centered around faces. Gunmen sport a variety of weaponry — the more primitive models only use large clubs or bare hands, while more advanced ones use cannons or beam weapons. Gunmen powered by the "Spiral Energy" inherent in humans' DNA are much more powerful than those piloted by Beastmen. Eventually, the types of machines seen in the show advance far beyond Gunmen.
 
====Spiral Energy====
====Spiral Energy====
â
[[Image:G-L - Core Drill Spiral.jpg|right|thumb|150px|The Core Drill, a symbol of Spiral Power]]
 
In the series' concept, the Spiral Energy is the power of evolution itself, generated by beings capable to do so, like humans and other DNA based animals, whose spiral molecular structure allows them to get stronger through the generations. Beastmen, because they can not reproduce naturally, cannot evolve, thus are unable to produce Spiral Power. The amount of Spiral Power produced by an individual may vary, and are based not only by its own limitations, but also by its own will to survive and persevere.

Beastmen, because they can not reproduce naturally, cannot evolve, thus are unable to produce Spiral Power. The amount of Spiral Power produced by an individual may vary, and are based not only by its own limitations, but also by its own will to survive and persevere.
